In order to achieve this goal, I have instructed the head of the Kuomintang to continue to help you." answer: Put forward the new Three Principles of the People and the three major policies
options:
Put forward the new Three Principles of the People and the three major policies
He led the revolution of 1911 to overthrow the Qing government
The Provisional Covenant Law was promulgated to safeguard democracy and the republic
From advocating reform to advocating revolution

"Opening the sea" and "banning the sea" are all limited foreign trade
European powers united against the Qing Dynasty is an important reason for the "sea ban"
During the period of Kangxi Emperor, the Qing government began to implement the sea prohibition policy

question: According to historians, the Yuan Dynasty banned the sea four times. The first time: in 29 years from Shizu to Yuan, "to expropriate Java, temporarily ban merchants from Jia Hai", to 31 years from Yuan; The second time: Dade 7 years to ban business to the sea, Emperor Wuzong to the first year of the restoration of the city ship department; The third time: to the big 4 years to strike the department of ship, Renzong Yanyou in the first year "to open the ban of the next city ship"; The fourth time: Yanyou 7 years "strike the ship department, ban Jia people next", Emperor to rule 2 years "restore the ship department in Quanzhou..." . This shows that _____
answer: The maritime prohibition policy of the Yuan Dynasty was very arbitrary and unfixed
options:
The Yuan Dynasty was as closed as previous feudal regimes
The sea embargo of the Yuan Dynasty was the prelude to the large-scale closed-door policy of Ming and Qing Dynasties
The main reason for the ban was to prevent pirates from harassing the southeast coast
The maritime prohibition policy of the Yuan Dynasty was very arbitrary and unfixed

It is worth noting that the number of career diplomats and industrialists is quite large, among which Gu Weijun, who represented China at the Paris Peace Conference and the Washington Conference, ranked third among the "Twelve big men", and Zhang Jian ranked eighth. The following analysis of the result of the survey, correctly stated is _____
options:
The Kuomintang's New Three Principles of the people were supported by the people, so most of the elected figures
The election of the warlord reflects that the Beiyang warlord rule at that time was widely supported by the Chinese people
Desire for development
Chen's high selection reflects the enormous influence of the Chinese Communist Party at that time, which cannot be ignored
